title: "Buy now" -- Font ID from small pic
content:
[http://i40.tinypic.com/33ncd8y.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022202028/http:/i40.tinypic.com/33ncd8y.png "http://i40.tinypic.com/33ncd8y.png")

Probably a long shot, but what comes closest?  
Thanks
author: Mikhail Kovalev

comments.content:
As the image is from the Lineto site _(Isn't it?)_, this would likely be a custom typeface.

But — You will likely find a rather close alternate at House Industries.

_Edit: Double post, due to another Typophile outage/'slowdown', it seems. I shall use this to at least add some helpful things and details, then. ;)_

It is. Some more samples: [http://www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy\_1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022202028/http:/www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy_1.png "http://www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy\_1.png") \> [http://www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy\_34.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022202028/http:/www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy_34.png "http://www.lineto.com/img/buttons/buy\_34.png") _(Just change the numbers ...)_

Showcard Stunt, Sign, House Slant and House Showcard, may be alternates, for example.
